divs: sighting detailsthis is very similar to this event... *(link moved to additional evidence section below--cms\sg). however, i want to add that it appeared to be moving slower than the relative speed of other aircraft in the sky. there were at least 4 commercial jets commercial jets flying overhead all with contrails. it did not have a contrail. it did not make any noise. i believe the orange glow that i saw which is also in the other reports was from the sunlight as it (the sun) was hanging below my horizon, but it was brighter than other aircraft. my first thought was that it was a satellite, but it was too early in dusk. it came from the southwest and was moving northeast for a few minutes. i turned away to answer the waitress and looked back, it was gone. it shouldn���t have been gone as when i turned away it was near the center of the sky. i continued looking for it over the next 20-30 minutes to no avail. 1.) sitting outside having dinner at a resteraunt. 2.) it was slightly brighter than other aircraft reflecting the sun���s light (as it was near dusk). i didn���t see any wings, hear any noise from it, and it was the only object without contrails 3.) blimp 4.) see above. 5.) irrelevant, but observed it in curiousity. 6.) see above.
Summary: Slowly moved from SW towards NE
trends: There have been 126 other sightings in Indianapolis
